revised_title: Reginald Innes Pocock: A Pioneering Zoologist and Mammalogist
tldr: Reginald Innes Pocock was a renowned zoologist and mammalogist who made significant contributions to the study of invertebrates and mammals. He worked at the British Museum and later became the Superintendent of the Zoological Gardens at Regent's Park. Pocock was a pioneer in using external characters for classification and contributed to the understanding of animal behavior, taxonomy, and the classification of various mammal species.
